org.mundo.net.transport
Interface ITransportService

All Known Implementing Classes:
IPTransportService
public interface ITransportService

Transport services implement this interface. A transport service provides connections to adjacent nodes. Since this definition should provide a unified interface to transport services, methods must not throw connection technology specific exceptions.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler

Nested Class Summary
static interface ITransportService.IConn
          Signals emitted by a transport service on connection changes.

          Connects to the specified peer.

Method Detail

openAsync

boolean openAsync(TypedMap map)
Connects to the specified peer. The method asynchronously starts a connect operation to the specified peer. The map contains service-specific parameters and is usually provided in neighbor messages.

Parameters:
map - a map containing the parameters.
Returns:
true: Indicates that the operation was successfully started; or if a connection to the specified address and port is already open; or a connect operation is pending.
false: if a parameter is missing in the map; or if an immediate error occurred.

openAsync

boolean openAsync(TransportLink link)
Connects to the specified peer. The method asynchronously starts a connect operation to the specified peer.

Parameters:
link - the transport link to open.
Returns:
true: Indicates that the operation was successfully started; or if a connection to the specified address and port is already open; or a connect operation is pending.
false: if the specified host is unknown.

send

boolean send(TransportLink link,
             Message msg)
Sends the specified message over the specified route. If the route does not have an open connection, the operation fails.

Parameters:
link - the transport link object.
msg - the message to send.
Returns:
true if the message could be sent successfully; false otherwise.
